page.title: 20EMPLOYMENT
page.content: A recent survey carried out by Tyne and Wear County Council estimated male unemployment on Town End Farm Estate to be approaching 40% Other surveys indicate an unwaged population of about 80% of the total possible work force. As a result Sunderland's first Unemployed Workers Centre was established on this estate. The Centre focuses a great deal on the difficulties and injustice faced by a large number of local residents with regard to unemployment. Other work at the Centre includes, activity programmes for the unemployed, support for the formation of locally based workers co-operatives, and womens conscious raising.
